ai.summary: Cross Walk is a short, easy 1.8 km hike in the UK designed for beginners and families seeking a relaxed outdoor stroll. The route offers gentle terrain and light scenery with minimal elevation change.
ai.terrain_summary: Flat to gently undulating trail along a well-maintained path. Expect a mix of compact gravel, grassy sections, and occasional muddy patches after rain. Sturdy footwear recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before you go. Stay on marked paths and supervise children. Carry a charged phone, basic first aid kit, and sufficient water. Let someone know your plans and expected return time. In winter, paths can be slippery; consider trekking poles for extra stability.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof walking shoes or boots
Map or offline GPS / fully charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for milder and drier conditions. Feasible in winter with appropriate clothing, but conditions can be challenging.
